channel.title: ActiveX screws up
channel.description:
What causes this? this problem is in internet Explorer AND in Mozilla Firefox.
[img]https://img687.imageshack.us/img687/3180/errorjo.jpg[/img]
In chrome it works perfectly but when I open any page in firefox or Ie nothing shows up eg: black mesa, steampowered... even gamespot doesn't work right. Is there a way of fixing it?

item.title: ActiveX screws up
item.dc:creator: Cup_o_Joe
item.description:
I already uninstalled it twice, it has to do with the windows registry.

Read full topic

item.title: ActiveX screws up
item.dc:creator: Edfake
item.description:
ok then, to re-install IE, go into add and remove programs (in control pannel) then on the icons on the left click on “add/remove windows components” it will come up with a setup dialouge. uncheck IE and press next, then press finish. restart your computer, then log back on. go again into add and remove programs then “add/remove windows components” but this time check the IE box and press next. restart this time if you wish.

Read full topic

item.title: ActiveX screws up
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Edfake:

ouch! does this problem only happen in IE?

Cup o Joe:

but when I open any page in firefox or Ie

I would assume not.

item.title: ActiveX screws up
item.dc:creator: Cup_o_Joe
item.description:
Someone told me to use the program “sfc /scannow”
and this is what happened when I put in the original windows XP professional CD, I have service pack three on the computer but only service pack one on the CD.

Read full topic

item.title: ActiveX screws up
item.dc:creator: Cup_o_Joe
item.description:
I did a virus check with Avast AND a spyware check with spybot search and destroy already. I think the registry is damaged, it started acting up when I did a registry cleanup with some trial registry cleaner, I think it deleted important files.

Read full topic
